H8147.def: = state in which a countable entity is two in number

H259.def: = state in which a countable entity is one in number

H2320.def: = period of time, measured by a complete cycle in the phases of the moon

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H7015.def: = a sung dirge or lament at the death of a loved one; ◄ death of a friend or family member; ► expression of loss at one's death

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H1819.def: = process by which part of the body is reduced to inactivity

H8577.def: = mythical sea monster, such as {L:behemoth<SDBH:בְּהֵמֹות>} and {L:leviathan<SDBH:לִוְיָתָן>}

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H1804.def: = causative action by which someone agitates a liquid by stirring it up with a tool or other object

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H7515.def: = action by which animals tread heavily and noisily on objects, ► resulting in destruction

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H3069.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H6566.def: = causative action by which humans spread out an object, such as a piece of cloth, a net, or a document either horizontally or vertically

H7568.def: = net of unknown size and shape; ► used for hunting birds and other animals, and also for fishing; ≈ associated with aggression and control

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H2764.def: = long net hanging vertically in the water with floats at the upper edge and weights at the lower edge; ► drawn in by men working in boats or from shore; as the ends are drawn together to the boat or drawn ashore, fish are trapped in the area enclosed by the net; drawn in immediately after it has been spread out; ≈ associated with aggression and control

H5203.def: = process by which ropes that used to be tightly strung begin to hang loose

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H2904.def: = causative action by which humans throw an object in a certain direction, often with force

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H7646.def: = process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled

H1320.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H7419.def: = objects that have been thrown away

H8248.def: = state in which objects contain a certain amount of moisture

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H6824.def: = process by which liquids flow from one place to another

H1818.def: = red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of {L:life<SDBH:נֶפֶשׁ>}; human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H650.def: = river bed that contains water in the rainy season only; ≈ considered as deceptive as one never can never be entirely sure as to whether they contain water or not

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H3518.def: = process by which a fire comes to an end, either in a natural way or by force

H3680.def: = state or process by which a surface is covered by another object, ► often making this surface more or less invisible

H215.def: = process by which something reflects light; ≈ associated with well-being

H216.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H6937.def: = process by which an object becomes dark in color

H1995.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects produce a variety of sounds, sometimes associated with natural phenomena like heavy rain and the waves of a stormy sea

H6913.def: = place where one or more people are buried, such as a hole in a rock or in the ground, or a place which was constructed specifically for this purpose; ≈ associated with death, stench and decay, uncleanness

H2719.def: = sharp object; ◄ made out of iron or flint; ► used as tool for various purposes

H2851.def: = causative action by which humans cause other humans to lack inner strength and courage, ◄ by acts of aggression

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H3639.def: = state in which humans experience a feeling of shame, as a result of their own actions or because of what other have done

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3381.def: = process by which objects move (involuntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place

H953.def: = a place where water wells up from an underground source

H4902.def: = a flexible container with an opening at the top, ◄ probably made out of leather
